item.title: DigitalOcean, Chef and Ohai - Retrieving a Droplet's Private IP Address
item.description: Recently, I attempted to use the Ohai value for node['cloud_v2']['local_ipv4'] and node['cloud']['local_ipv4']['ip_address'] to determine the Private IP address of my Cloud-based nodes in a Chef cookbook. Unfortunately, it does not work accurately for DigitalOcean instances any longer. According to DigitalOcean documentation, if Private Networking is enabled, the IP will be assigned to eth1. Recently, I noticed that a second Private IP address has begun to be assigned to the eth0 interface.
